intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium paxianum, commonly known as the Paxian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It features basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy, with a height ranging from 20 to 60 centimeters. The flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are usually sterile, giving the plant a daisy-like appearance.
